ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Twin A or Twin B
Notes: A = Twin A; B = Twin B

ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for subject's sibling
site specific sibling1 ID
Type of Sibling
ValueRange: Full Brother FB; Half Mother Brother HMB; Half Father Brother HFB; Full Sister FS; Half Mother Sister HMS; Half Father Sister HFS; Adopted Brother AB; Adopted Sister AS; Unknown

ElementDescription: Age -Sibling 1(in months)
Gender -Sibling 1
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; 1= Male; 2= Female; 3= Transgender

ElementDescription: P: How often do you know how your child is doing in different subjects at school?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3=About half of the time (50%); 4=More than half, but not always (75%); 5=Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: P: How often do you know how your child is doing at work/other daily activities?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3=About half of the time (50%); 4=More than half, but not always (75%); 5=Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: P: How often do you know where your child goes when they are out with friends at night?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3=About half of the time (50%); 4=More than half, but not always (75%); 5=Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: P: How often do you know where your child goes and what your child does after school?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3=About half of the time (50%); 4=More than half, but not always (75%); 5=Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: P: How often do you know where your child goes and what your child does when not at home or work?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3=About half of the time (50%); 4=More than half, but not always (75%); 5=Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: P: In the last month, how often have you had no idea where your child was at night?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3=About half of the time (50%); 4=More than half, but not always (75%); 5=Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: P: During the past month, how often have you started a conversation about your child''s free time?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3=About half of the time (50%); 4=More than half, but not always (75%); 5=Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: P: How often do you initiate a conversation about things that happened during a normal day at school?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3=About half of the time (50%); 4=More than half, but not always (75%); 5=Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: P: How often do you initiate a conversation about things that happened to your child during the day?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3=About half of the time (50%); 4=More than half, but not always (75%); 5=Yes, always (100%)
